qas.question: When did Britain first use brass?
Who were the first copper miners in North America?
Where was native copper extracted with primitive tools between 800 and 1600?
What country had a strong copper production in 1000 AD
When did commercial production of copper begin?
When did Britain ban use of brass?
Who were the only copper miners in North America?
Where was native copper hidden with primitive tools between 800 and 1600?
What country stopped a strong copper production in 1000 AD?
When did commercial production of copper end?

context: Britain's first use of brass occurred around the <a0_0><b5_0>3rd–2nd century BC<b5_0/><a0_0/>. In North America, copper mining began with marginal workings by <a1_0><b6_0>Native Americans<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Native copper is known to have been extracted from sites on <a2_0><b7_0>Isle Royale<b7_0/><a2_0/> with primitive stone tools between 800 and 1600. Copper metallurgy was flourishing in South America, particularly in <a3_0><b8_0>Peru<b8_0/><a3_0/> around 1000 AD; it proceeded at a much slower rate on other continents. Copper burial ornamentals from the 15th century have been uncovered, but the metal's commercial production did not start until the <a4_0><b9_0>early 20th century<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
